Run Regression Model Building

Source: R/02-run.R
run.Rd

Run Regression Model Building

Usage

run(
  obj,
  f = c("gaussian", "coxph", "binomial", "Gamma", "inverse.gaussian", "poisson", "quasi",
    "quasibinomial", "quasipoisson"),
  exp = NULL,
  ci = 0.95,
  parallel = FALSE,
  ...
)

Arguments

obj

a REGObject R6 object.

f

a length-1 string specifying modeling function or family of glm(), default is 'coxph'. Other options are members of GLM family, see stats::family(). 'binomial' is logistic, and 'gaussian' is linear.

exp

logical, indicating whether or not to exponentiate the the coefficients.

ci

confidence Interval (CI) level. Default to 0.95 (95%). e.g. survival::coxph().

parallel

if TRUE, use N-1 cores to run the task.

...

other parameters passing to corresponding regression model function.

Value

a REGObject R6 object.

Examples

x <- prepare(
  data = mtcars,
  vars_y = "mpg",
  vars_x = c("factor(cyl)", colnames(mtcars)[3:5]),
  vars_c = c(colnames(mtcars)[8:9], "factor(gear)")
)
x <- x |> run()
x
#> An object of class REGObject 
#> 	 variable y: mpg 
#> 	 variable x: factor(cyl),disp,hp,drat 
#> 	covariables: vs,am,factor(gear) 
#> 
#> model built options:
#> $f
#> [1] "gaussian"
#> 
#> $exp
#> NULL
#> 
#> $ci
#> [1] 0.95
#> 
#> $parallel
#> [1] FALSE
#> 
#> 
#> model data head:
#>      cyl  disp    hp  drat   mpg    vs    am  gear
#>    <num> <num> <num> <num> <num> <num> <num> <num>
#> 1:     6   160   110  3.90  21.0     0     1     4
#> 2:     6   160   110  3.90  21.0     0     1     4
#> 3:     4   108    93  3.85  22.8     1     1     4
#> 4:     6   258   110  3.08  21.4     1     0     3
#> 5:     8   360   175  3.15  18.7     0     0     3
#> 6:     6   225   105  2.76  18.1     1     0     3
